item.title: Pokemon Pokopia details DJ Rotom, Chef Dente, and multiplayer mode
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Latest trailer and screenshots.

The Pokemon Company and developers Game Freak and Koei Tecmo have released a new trailer and screenshots for life simulation game Pokemon Pokopia in celebration of Pokemon Day 2026.

Here are the latest details (as transcribed from today‚Äôs trailer):

Rotom (Stereo Rotom)

Is that curious looking stereo a Rotom? Did it get enticed by the music and hop inside? It‚Äôs really energetic and seems to go by DJ Rotom.

What happens if you give it a CD in the game? It can help liven up the town with a variety of music! Ditto and the others are grooving to the beat, too. Let‚Äôs listen to DJ Rotom‚Äôs specially selected tracks while I introduce you to the world of Pokemon Pokopia.

Wasteland

Ditto first encounters Professor Tangrowth in a wasteland that was once a town.

It seems like Ditto is working alongside other Pokemon to develop the town.

Wow, they‚Äôre sure fired up!

Of course, you can‚Äôt give your all on an empty stomach.

It looks like Riolu wants something to eat, too. But how do you cook?

Greedent (Cook)

Huh? That silhouette‚Ä¶ A Greedent appeared. It sounds like everyone calls it Chef Dente!

Chef Dente can teach you how to cook all sorts of dishes. Each Pokemon has different foods they prefer. Some dishes will even power up your moves when you eat them. This will make it even easier to develop the town.

Four-Player Multiplayer Mode

Try bringing Pokemon you‚Äôve befriended on an outing!

In multiplayer mode, you can visit other players towns. You can play with up to three other people.

First, let‚Äôs play some hide and seek. I wonder where everyone‚Äôs hiding? Ah, there you are! There‚Äôs someone here, too! But where‚Äôs the last one? Whoa! You can transform into objects, too! That was a fun game of hide and seek!

By working together, you could even build something this big.

Together, you can develop a town or go on far-off adventures. New encounters may await you as well. Every day, the world gets bigger and bigger, developing a town one step at a time.

Pokemon Pokopia is due out for Switch 2 on March 5, 2026.

Watch the trailer below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

Pokemon Day 2026 Trailer

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A DLC ‚ÄòMega Dimension‚Äô adds Mega Garchomp Z
item.content:encoded:
Battle and defeat a Mega Garchomp Z to obtain a Garchompite Z stone.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A downloadable content ‚ÄúMega Dimension‚Äù has added Mega-Evolved Pokemon Mega Garchomp Z as of today, publisher The Pokemon Company and developer Game Freak announced.

Get the latest details below.

A newly discovered form of Garchomp‚ÄîMega Garchomp Z‚Äîhas been unveiled in Pokemon Legends: Z-A downloadable content ‚ÄúMega Dimension.‚Äù

Mega Garchomp Z

  • Category: Mach Pokemon
  • Type: Dragon
  • Height: 6‚Äô3‚Ä≥ (1.9 m)
  • Weight: 218.3 lbs. (99 kg)

Starting today, players can claim a new Mystery Gift that will unlock the opportunity to enter a special hyperspace distortion where they must battle and defeat a Mega Garchomp Z to obtain a Garchompite Z stone.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A and the downloadable content ‚ÄúMega Dimension‚Äù are available now for Switch 2 and Switch.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.
